text: Eli Lilly and Company v. Medtronic, Inc., 496 U.S. 661 (1990), is a United States Supreme Court case related to patent infringement in the medical device industry. It held that (e)(1). of United States patent law exempted premarketing activity conducted to gain approval of a device under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act from a finding of infringement.. ==See also== * Medtronic, Inc. v. Lohr (1996) * Riegel v. Medtronic, Inc.
